Overview   Package  Class  Use  Tree  Deprecated  Index  Help 
 PREV PACKAGE   NEXT PACKAGE FRAMES    NO FRAMES    

Package com.google.wave.api

Interface Summary
Blip A blip is a unit of conversation in a Wave.
Event An event captures changes made to a Wavelet, Blip, or Document in the Wave system.
FormView The FormView is a view of a document that simplifies management of form elements.
GadgetView The GadgetView is a view of a document that simplifies management of gadgets and gadget state.
RobotMessageBundle Interface to a Robot Message Bundle used to process incoming Wave events.
RobotServlet An interface for processing Robot events.
TextView The TextView is a view of a document that simplifies management of the text content that it contains.
Wavelet A Wavelet represents a part of a threaded conversation and is the unit of access control for a wave.
 

Class Summary
AbstractRobot An abstract implementation of a Robot that handles deserialization of events and serialization of operations and implements callbacks for the profile and capabilities.
AbstractRobotServlet An abstract implementation of a Robot Servlet that handles deserialization of events and serialization of operations.
Annotation An annotation is metadata that augments a range of text in a Document.
Capability A Capability represents a Robot's interest in handling a given event.
Element Elements are non-text content within a document.
FormElement Form Elements allow users and robots to build forms for other users to interact with.
Gadget Gadgets are external code that can be executed within a protected environment within a Wave.
Image Represents an image within a Wave.
ParticipantProfile ParticipantProfile represents participant information.
ProfileServlet Servlet that handles profile related requests from Google Wave.
Range Defines a range for an annotation.
StyledText StyledText represents a styled text region, that provides API to set or unset StyleType.
 

Enum Summary
Context Enumeration that represents the context that the robot needs to provide when calling the Robot's event handler.
ElementType Element Types.
EventType The types of events that Robots can process.
StyleType Text styles supported by Robots.
